Review: After experiencing a lot of hours I think I can have the right to type the good and the bad sides of the game. First of all, I have to tell you that the game is almost not playable unless if you don't have a well working SSD. (Doesn't matter M.2 or SATA) Battlefield franchise has been going down since the last titles of the series. When Battlefield 2042 first released, People said that the game is literally unplayable in every sides. But the good thing is that THE GAME HAS BEEN FIXED TECHNICALLY RIGHT NOW. You don't usually see technical problems if you have a good setup. THE GOOD SIDES AND ITS FEATURES 1-) Playing Sundance and Mackay is actually so fun in Conquest that you can even flank the enemies from behind and get a lot of frags. 2-)The game has faster gameplay mechanics compared to older titles. Which means you can get the fastest kills. Depends on your gameplay but I like it. 3-)Some of Rifles and guns are really cool to play. Rate of fires are much higher compared to BF3 and 4. 4-)Squad Revive. It's not a new feature but I find it ok to include in the series. 5-)Changing Gun attachments is a game changer if you can change and play it correctly. 6-)Cross Play and 128 player servers. Both of them were not really necessary but they make us find the servers easier. 7-)You can finally see how much people there are in the objectives you're playing in (Teammates and enemies). 8-)You can call for a vehicle while you're running as an infantry in that damn vehicle based maps such as Hourglass and Renewal. But it needs a free slot to call it. So sometimes you have to wait for it or give it up. 9-)Battle Pass is worth paying if you only wanna get a lot of xp booster and Battlefield coins as the game refunds some of them as a progression reward. THE BAD SIDES (unfortunately) 1-)The game literally does not have official server browser and choosing the maps you want to play. In that case, It's all RNG. There is only one way to change the maps is that when you click the game mode you're willing to play, the game counts 5 to 0. When it has found a server and in that moment, you can cancel searching the game if you don't want that map. For Example: If you are getting Hourglass and don't want to play it, Then cancel searching the game and try it again until you find a good one. No comment on that. 2-)Sometimes (at least for me) I'm getting black screen when I first launch the game. I have searched a lot of forums, threads and topics in order to fix it but couldn't find any working solution. 3-)There is no team switching. 4-)The game has only 2 countries. Which is not a cool thing to me as Battlefield 4 had 3 countries in it. (Battlefield 1 had 9) 5-) I have mentioned the SSD requirement above. 6-)Sometimes (again) the game is not loading the main menu when leaving the server. It got stuck in Black screen like I got in the first launch. But despite everything, I kinda liked the game. At least It's playable. You should give it a try if you have a good setup and curious about 2042. Thank you for reading.

Review: Graphics: looks good, plays well at high res on mid end machines, camera can be panned and tilted but not to the cinematic extremes of total war or company of heroes. maps have an early 20th century European feel to them, lots of bushes and low rural walls for cover. plenty of lush countryside and forestry little villages and the likes Campaign: The campaign is somewhat emotional, has a strong start. heavily inspired by WW1/2 from the invaded sides point of view, but with a steampunk mech twist. the primative mechs stutter and struggle towards their destinations towering above infantry units. the old timey war cutscene footage with the spliced in mechs are really cool. the ability to play with the voice acting in their original languages is also a really cool feature people may like for better immersion. Gameplay from MP perspective: taking heavily from company of heroes it is your standard RTS streamlined somewhat for quick battles. you will have some points to choose a few special units while the game is starting. theres your HQ and there are two production structures among the three launch factions (russians, polish, germans) these are for your infantry and mech productions. these must be constructed with the engineer unit you will spawn with alongside a scout unit, once the production structures are upgraded once they will unlock the second tier of units for production, iron and oil are required for productions, you will capture nodes on the map for iron and oil (usually not very far away on very claustrophobic maps) which can be upgraded once to increase output. its a tug of war with these nodes and a race to create a few big mechs to go stomping the enemy HQ or holding the victory point flags. infantry movement is similar to company of heroes, green and yellow dots signalling strong and weak cover, the can be faced in a direction, retreated to HQ for reinforcement and come with abilities that instead of purchased can be used if you level them up in combat. units can also pickup equipment on the ground so they can resume the positions of other fallen units. i have not played long enough to have any balancing comments. there is usually one upgrade for one structure and little else to purchase anything other than units, theres no need to make multiple structures as units are made in 5-10 seconds so the pace is fast and furious Other content: it has challenge maps, and custom games can be set up for player v bot not much to comment on here other than the AI on easy basically just let us have everything and didn't make any advanced units until the final moments, its very easy to learn the game from a quick skirmish match vs the ai since there are no complex production trees and upgrades launch comments: complaints are low map count, missing coop and poor MP implementation, all are true however more maps and coop are coming in the next few weeks still undergoing crunch time testing presumably. steam workshop will be on the table in the coming years. personally i'm not too upset but i hope they keep a good pace of updates to placate and maintain the players base and i would also like to see a server browser or party system for matchmaking

Review: I was skeptical that kojima could make another franchise as good as metal gear. boy was i wrong. please do not be put off by the 'walking simulator' aspect. it is actually far more involved and enjoyable than i originally thought it would be, along the way you will connect a network together that allows you to 3D print new tools and upgrades, ziplines. shelter fast travel points. even vehicles, put some thought into it and your trips will be super easy. however i do recommend this game on at least hard to make the combat and stealth more consequential. The trips needed to advance the story are straight forward and short usually done in about 10 minutes, the cutscenes usually take longer, in proper kojima fashion. come the end of the journey (its supposed to feel like a treacherous journey not an easy stroll) your character will comment as much, he is done with this sh** and so are you. bringing everyone together and unlocking the nuts story is the main driving force and the biggest sense of acheivement in this game comes from using the connections and structures you have made to bring the world together and prevent an extinction event. Periodically the game will remove the ability to build really highlighting how much you need other players and npc's to build with you and make the game easier. by the time i completed the game the highway was done and someone set up ziplines all over the mountains im getting a 20 minute trek done in 2 minutes There is sneaking and combat in this game, at first its fairly difficult but you will eventually unlock lethal  and non lethal anti human and anti supernatural weapons. sneaking works very well around the supernatural. you need to hold your breath and be completely silent to get the sneak on them, if they get you. you leave a crater where you died temporarily blocking that route and losing any cargo or vehicles in that area. if you die you will usually respawn not too far away like it rewinded time for a few minutes. when fighting humans its important to note that a corpse will mutate into a supernatural monster within 24 hours so it encourages you to cremate the bodies so that you do not make the game harder for other players. This is the only game i have played where they have a story based explanation for why he is un-killable (oh boy its a good one) there are some grand boss fights but they are fairly straight forward fights. This game-play is not for everyone ill admit, but the story is top notch and is slightly more coherent than his previous series. this game needs no sequel. ill be the first to admit the ending was amazing and had me trying to suck in my tears for nearly an hour. then i was in a heavy trance thinking about the implications of the story for a bit afterwards. in conclusion: Great game that slowly sucks you into its conspiracy based story, has you exploring beautifully detailed yet intentionally empty worlds for survivors to physically and metaphorically rebuild the country in the face of extinction to give you and your baby a future. it is a wild ride

Review: It was a bit of a mess when it launched but it has been cleaned up and there is more communication with the devs. Horde Is way better balanced now and from what i hear it will be even better next season. the matchmaking system has been streamlined for quick matches, and the custom browser is there for wave 50 classic modes. every character can now buy every weapon and defenses making play with jack and del much easier. the money taps now also give the team a health boost Fan Favourites are back and have their own suite of abilities in horde, versus and escape. along with skins and such to unlock via the battlepass-like leveling up system. Many bugs and problems have been solved however some still remain in horde with jack and some in campaign that may require a few resets or the host skipping ahead for a tutorial section and then inviting the buddy back, 3 player campaign is still a treat. Escape is still meh. i don't care for it much, there's more content and characters there A new currency has been introduced as a reward for challenges and levelling up. this now allows you to buy all your characters and skins, every single one! this is major upgrade over the stupid totem system and you will be compensated for any you haven not finished if you are returning after the totem update. Versus still has many modes ranging between bot training, ranked, casual and arcade modes which all vary in flow and intensity. there are no reverse horde type modes yet from gears 3 and judgement, which i am hoping for. Overall the new progress and unlock system really gives you more incentive to play longer hours as its easier to get and upgrade these new and old school characters. The horde modes rebalancing gives you both quick matches where defenses don't matter so much and more versatility in classic matches for the weaker support characters, it really helps that the assualt characters can make defenses but it does not break the game as the defensive characters still excel at constructing and repairing your base. Being able to buy every gun as every character took the tedium out of finding a replacement when you die or spawn at wave 1 Currently Exactly what i wanted from a new gears game.
